page.title: 18LARGE ESTATES NEAR BUCHLYVIE
page.content: {GARDEN ESTATE}is a country park estate consisting of the main house, built from stone taken from the demolition of the TOWER OF GARDEN in{1749.}The front was added in{1837}in Georgian style. The interior was altered in { {1975}to accommodate a separate flat on the ground floor. The original estate was over{5000 acres}but is now{3700} acres, mostly tenanted farms and the estate includes the village of{ {ARNPRIOR}as far down as CARDROSS bridge. The original owners were the FORRESTERS of ARNGIBBON before being bought by SIR JOHN STIRLING who was given the title of{LORD GARDEN. {BALLAMENOCH}consists of a two storey house, built around{1898,}and just under{50 acres}of land. Most of this land is let for agricultural use.The house was formerly owned by the{LAIRD {of BUCHLYVIE, DONALD FISHER.
